front.title: Network Configuration Extensions : Access Control Model

abstract.t: The standardization of network configuration interfaces for use with the NETCONF protocol requires a structured data modeling environment which promotes human usability and multi-vendor interoperability. The Network Configuration Extensions (NCX) are a set of specifications intended to address NETCONF data modeling issues. This document defines an Access Control Model (ACM) suitable for use with the NETCONF protocol, intended to promote a more consistent, manageable, and interoperable infra-structure for ongoing development of NETCONF-based management interfaces.
